did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Ethel Armes Collection of Lee Family Papers 1671-1936
did.abstract: Correspondence, architectural plans, genealogical papers, maps, legal papers, clippings, and other material assembled by Armes in preparing her book, Stratford Hall: The Great House of the Lees (1936).

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically therein.

controlaccess.persname: Armes, Ethel, 1876-1945.

Lee, Henry, 1756-1818. Henry Lee papers.

Washington, George, 1732-1799--Correspondence.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Ethel Armes Collection of Lee Family Papers was given to the Library of Congress by Armes between 1936 and 1939.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Ethel Armes Collection of Lee Family Papers was arranged and described in 1984. Ciphers used by the Lees, prepared by Edmund Cody Burnett, were transferred to the Edmund Cody Burnett Papers in 1998. The finding aid was revised in 2008 and additional revisions were made to the finding aid in 2009.

userestrict.head: Copyright Statu
userestrict.p: The status of copyright in the unpublished writings in the Ethel Armes Collection of Lee Family Papers is governed by the Copyright Law of the United States (Title 17, U.S.C.).

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The Ethel Armes Collection of Lee Family Papers are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Manuscript Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container number, Ethel Armes Collection of Lee Family Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Ethel Armes Collection of Lee Family Papers consists principally of photocopies and transcripts of documents found in other repositories. Armes collected and assembled these in preparation for her book, Stratford Hall: The Great House of the Lees (1936). Materials date from 1671 to 1936 and include family correspondence of the Lee and Shippen families pertaining mainly to life during the Revolutionary War period. The bulk of the correspondence is that of Henry "Lighthorse Harry" Lee, Revolutionary War general and father of Robert E. Lee, and Major Henry Lee, brother of Robert E. Lee. Subjects detailed in the correspondence include military activities during the Revolutionary War, politics and political appointments, financial affairs in the colonies, agriculture, planting, and slavery in Virginia, and family life on Shirley Plantation. Among other family members represented in the collection are Charles Carter Lee, Richard Bland Lee, Mary Randolph Custis and Robert E. Lee, Alice Lee Shippen, Thomas Lee Shippen, and William Shippen. One noteworthy item in the collection is a copy of a letter of former slave Eleanor Berry to Elizabeth Collins Lee, her previous mistress. Duff Green, Nathanael Greene, Alexander Hamilton, James Madison, John Tyler, and George Washington are among the more prominent correspondents in the collection.

Copies of architectural plans and drawings of various Lee family estates, family genealogies, legal papers, maps, and newspaper clippings are included in the collection. The few original documents in the Ethel Armes Collection of Lee Family Papers consist mainly of research notes and correspondence of Armes and pertain to her book. Of particular interest is a letter of Franklin D. Roosevelt to Armes; Roosevelt wrote the foreword to her book.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Papers
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged alphabetically by type of material or name of person.
